}} The 'Palace of Versailles' ( or ; ), or simply 'Versailles', is a royal
chÃ¢teau in Versailles in the Ãle-de-France region of France. In French it is the
'ChÃ¢teau de Versailles'.

When the chÃ¢teau was built, Versailles was a country village; today, however, it
is a wealthy suburb of Paris, some 20 kilometres southwest of the French
capital. The court of Versailles was the centre of political power in France
from 1682, when Louis XIV moved from Paris, until the royal family was forced to
return to the capital in October 1789 after the beginning of the French
Revolution. Versailles is therefore famous not only as a building, but as a
symbol of the system of absolute monarchy of the [[Ancien RÃ©gime]].
